intro: Cambessedesia hilariana var. obtusifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
